column4: I don't see videos in youtube... I do have flash plugin installed. what can be the problem?
which flash plugin do you have?
enter 'about:plugins' as the URL if you're not sure
Shockwave Flash 9.0 r124
is there any other relevant plugin, like gnash?
maybe this one: Totem Web Browser Plugin 2.22.1 video/flv
no, that one won't conflict
so.... I just see grey screen in the place of the flash player in youtube
I'm not sure what's wrong then. Have you restarted firefox?
tried that already...
are you on a 64bit system?
did you install flash from the Ubuntu repository?
I installed it first when I went to youtube and it said I need to install plugins to make videos work.. I installed flash plugin and now it doesn't work :\
uninstall the plugin with firefox, then exit firefox. Run 'sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree', then start firefox again.
this procedure will adapt the 32bit plugin for your 64bit browser.
how are you getting on?
Working :) thanks...
always use Ubuntu repos when you have a choice :)
:) thanks. I was sure that the browser installs the same thing, as when I searched later for "flash" in synaptic the nonfree flash plugin was installed there.
the secret is in the postinstall procedure. It uses nspluginwrapper to make the 32bit plugin usable in your 64bit environment
and dimisdas: I checked already... it should work without problems
